title: powers conferred on me by section 1(3) of the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019 

(Section 16) (Commencement) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited social welfare (no 2) act 2019 (section 16) (commencement) order 2020

title: powers conferred on me by section 1(3) of the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019
heading: 2. The 20th day of November 2020 is appointed as the day on which
text_raw:
2. The 20th day of November 2020 is appointed as the day on which 
Section 16 of the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019 (No. 48 of 2019) shall come 
into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 November, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [551] 3

title: powers conferred on me by section 1(3) of the Social Welfare (No. 2) Act 2019
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order provides for the commencement of Section 16 of the Social Welfare 
(No. 2) Act 2019. 

Section 16 repeals section 282 of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 
which currently provides for reduced cost life event (birth, marriage or death) 
certificates. 

This Order will be commenced in parallel with the commencement of sections 
27(a), 27(c) and 30(a) of the Civil Registration (Amendment) Act 2014. Those 
provisions will allow regulations to be made by the Minister for Employment 
Affairs and Social Protection for the purpose of setting the fees (if any) for the 
provision of life event certificates.
